required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Percutaneous Needle Electrolysis (PNE) in Soleus Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of the Application of Ultrasound-guided Percutaneous Needle Electrolysis on the Chronic Soleus Injury in Dancers

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates if the physiotherapy treatment based on eccentric exercise, ultrasound-guided PNE or a combination of both therapies on chronic soleous injuries may cause changes in pain, functionality, dorsal flexion of the foot, balance and muscle fatigue in dancers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline VAS at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale (VAS: 0=no pain; 100= pain as bad as can be

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline lunge test at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: This test measures the ankle range of motion. Less than 9/10 cm, range of motion will be considered restricted

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline releve test at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: During the unilateral balance test with open eyes, the participant will be asked to hold as much time as possible in the relay position (raised heel of the floor) on one leg

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline endurance test at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: The unilateral raised heel test. The dancer should repeatedly lift the heel from the floor to the maximum range of plantar flexion movement as many times as possible.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline balance test at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: The test will be conducted with closed eyes, flat feet and barefoot participants and dancers will perform a retir√© position. Participants will maintain the position as long as possible.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline DFOS questionnaire at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: This questionnaire measures the pain and function (0= bad; 90=well)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the Minimal Detectable Change (MCD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from after treatment at 3 months months
primary_outcome.description: The minimal detectable change is defined as a valid change in score that is not due to chance. Minimally clinically important difference (MCID), in comparison, goes beyond valid change to assess meaningful difference in dance function

arm_group.description: The dancers of this group wil perform a soleus eccentric exercise

The dancers of this group will receive a PNE treatment, consisting of the application of galvanic current, by ultrasound. The approach will be performed with a transverse axis with a needle orientation that will depend on the location of the target tissue. The parameters will be 3 mA, 3 seconds, 3 impacts (3: 3: 3). The periodicity will be 1day/7day/21day
The dancers of this group will receive a combined treatment and will be carried out in the same way as the other two groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over 16 years.
- at least 5 years of formal dance training.
- at least 20 hours of training per week.
- Pain in the back of the leg
- diagnosis of chronic soleus injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unsurpassed fear of needles
- History of adverse reactions to needles
- Immune system disorder
- Difficulty expressing your feelings properly
- Epilepsy and / or allergies to metals.
- Other lower limbs pathology
